content:
âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Pretty basic and easy. Ideal for fun :)

As pointed out by @5DN1L, please remove the additional newline from the inputs of all Tests, and from the input/output pair of Validator 5.

As a minimal fix for explaining the rules R and K (players shouldn't need to guess what they mean), you can simply add them to the first paragraph of your problem statement:

"You are given a sentence [[S]] and a list of rules [[R]].
Each rule tells you whether the corresponding word in [[S]] must be <<reversed>> ({{R}}) or <<kept as-is>> ({{K}})."

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun and quick, as expected for a clash of code.

Please study the formatting syntax on this page ( https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement ) and apply formats as described below.

Input
* Please format all line numbers in <<bold>>, e.g. <<Line 1>>.

* Please format all [[variables]], e.g. [[N]].

* Please format all {{constants}}, i.e. {{R}} and {{K}}, and remove the quotation marks.

* Please move the meanings of R and K to the Goal section.

Output
* Please format "Line 1" in <<bold>>.

Constraints
* Please add:
1 â‰¤ [[N]] â‰¤ 10
1 â‰¤ length of each word in [[S]] â‰¤ 10
Every word in [[S]] contains lowercase English letters only.

Stub generator / Cases
* Please change lines 2 and 3 as follows:
loopline N S:word(10)
read R:word(N)

* You'll notice that the last two cases have issues after you change the stub generator. Please fix those cases accordingly.

Thanks.

There may be some misunderstanding regarding my previous comment. I asked you to *move* the meanings of {{R}} and {{K}} to the Goal section; I did *not* ask you to *remove* them. Could you please correct this?

In addition, for the cases:

* Please remove the trailing newlines from the *input* of the cases below:
  â€¢ Test 1
  â€¢ Test 2
  â€¢ Test 3
  â€¢ Test 4
  â€¢ Test 5
  â€¢ Validator 5

* Please remove the trailing newline from the *output* of the case below:
  â€¢ Validator 5

Thanks.
Please consider withdrawing your approval as the trailing newline issue hasn't been fixed. Thanks.
Could you please read other people's comments, understand that there are unfixed issues and withdraw your approval? Thanks.
The trailing newline issue has been fixed now, right? I don't see them
They're still there. You have to click the EDIT button and then the individual input/output fields to see them.
Thank you for helping out! Though I do hope the author can fix it themselves. ðŸ™‚
